title: Residents, pets flee two-alarm apartment-complex fire
title_page: Residents, pets flee two-alarm apartment-complex fire
maintext:
Apartment residents and their pets were forced to flee, some dangling from the upper story, today as a two-alarm fire swept through a building at Golfview Apartments on St. Joe Road.
A few minor injuries were reported.
Crews arrived three minutes after the fire was reported at 4:43 p.m. to find multiple people trapped inside and police on the scene throwing ladders to assist people, including children, who were escaping from windows, said Paul Veldman, the Fort Wayne Fire Department’s chief of operations, at the scene.
Veldman said he didn’t know where the fire broke out, but a large hole was cut from the top center of the building and many people escaped from the upper story of the two-story building.
For more on this story, see Friday’s print edition of The Journal Gazette or visit www.journalgazette.net after 1 a.m. Friday.
